Class TransactionSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guidewire.pl.persistence.code.BeanBase
      • entity.TransactionSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.guidewire.commons.entity.Keyable, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Sourceable, com.guidewire.pl.persistence.core.BeanMethods, Approvable, CreatedViaDelegate, Editable, Extractable, KeyableBean, Retireable, Validatable, Versionable, Bean, BundleProvider, java.lang.Comparable<Bean>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CheckSet, RecoveryReserveSet, RecoverySet, ReserveSet

    @Generated(value="com.guidewire.pl.metadata.codegen.Codegen",
           comments="TransactionSet.eti;TransactionSet.eix;TransactionSet.etx")
public abstract class TransactionSet
extends com.guidewire.pl.persistence.code.BeanBase
implements Retireable, Validatable, Approvable, Extractable, CreatedViaDelegate
    TransactionSet A set of transactions submitted for approval together. Subtypes include ReserveSet, RecoverySet, and RecoveryReserveSet, which contain the respective Transaction types. A CheckSet contains Checks and Payments. There is no PaymentSet.

      • approveByGroupSupervisor

        public boolean approveByGroupSupervisor()
        Causes the approval activity to be sent to the supervisor of the group to which the exposure is assigned, if there is exactly one exposure, or the group to which the claim is assigned otherwise.

        Note: This method should only be called from a rule in the Approval Routing ruleset.

        Returns:
        false if the approving user would be the user who submitted the approval bean - if, for instance, the user were the supervisor of the group to which the claim/exposure is assigned, or if the claim and exposure are not yet assigned

      • approveByUserSupervisor

        public boolean approveByUserSupervisor()
        Handles the use case of an approval working its way up the user's group chain.

        Note: This method should only be called from a rule in the Approval Routing ruleset.

        Assign to the submitting user's supervisor, determined in the following manner:

        • First, if the submitting user is the supervisor of the root group, short circuit the following and assign to the Default Owner.
        • Second, consider the claim or exposure's owning group:
          1. If submitting user is in the group and is not the supervisor of the group or a parent group, then approval goes to the group supervisor.
          2. If the submitting user is a supervisor of the group or a parent group, approval goes to the supervisor of the group above the highest group the user supervises.
        • Third, if the user is neither a member of the owning group, nor a supervisor of the owning group or one of its parents, consider groups the submitting user belongs to. Repeat the steps above, at least one of which must now succeed.
        NOTE: If the user is a member of multiple groups and assignment reaches the third step, the assignment may be nondeterministic, since none of the user's groups has priority, and the order in which they are returned is undefined.
        Returns:
        false if assignment is unsuccessful

      • evaluateExpressionAsIfSubmitted

        public CurrencyAmount evaluateExpressionAsIfSubmitted(FinancialsExpression expression,
                                                      CoverageType coverageType,
                                                      CostType costType,
                                                      CostCategory costCategory)
        Returns the amount of the FinancialsExpression as if the Transactions in this set have all reached Submitted status. Optionally, includes only those ReserveLines and transactions that match the given CoverageType, CostType and CostCategory. Note that offsetting Reserves in a CheckSet are left as is when evaluating the amount.
        Parameters:
        expression - the FinancialsExpression to calculate. See AbstractFinancialsExpression.
        coverageType - can be null - in which case all coverage types are matched
        costType - can be null - in which case all CostTypes are matched
        costCategory - can be null - in which case all CostCategories are matched
        Returns:
        amount of the financials calc. null if no transactions (in the set or preexisting) contribute to the financials calculation.

      • evaluateExpressionByExposureAsIfSubmitted

        public CurrencyAmount evaluateExpressionByExposureAsIfSubmitted(FinancialsExpression expression,
                                                                Exposure exposure,
                                                                CostType costType,
                                                                CostCategory costCategory)
        Returns the amount of the FinancialsExpression as if the Transactions in this set have all reached Submitted status. Optionally, includes only those ReserveLines and transactions that match the given Exposure, CostType, and CostCategory. Note that offsetting Reserves in a CheckSet are left as is when evaluating the amount.
        Parameters:
        expression - the FinancialsExpression to calculate. See AbstractFinancialsExpression.
        exposure - can be null - in which case only claim-level transactions are matched
        costType - can be null - in which case all CostTypes are matched
        costCategory - can be null - in which case all CostCategories are matched
        Returns:
        amount of the financials calc. null if no transactions (in the set or preexisting) contribute to the financials calculation.

      • getActivities

        public Activity[] getActivities()
        Gets the value of the Activities field. Set of approval / approval denial activities linked to this transaction set.

      • getAllTransactions

        public Transaction[] getAllTransactions()
        Returns all transactions that belong to this TransactionSet. For CheckSets, this also returns any offsetting reserves and payments on add-ons.

        Subclasses need to implement this.

        Returns the list of exposures that the transactions in this TransactionSet belong to.

      • getID

        getID in interface Versionable

      • getLastApprovingUser

        public User getLastApprovingUser()
        Returns the last user who approved this TransactionSet.

        For example, if User A submits a TransactionSet for approval, then the LastApprovingUser is User A. Suppose that TransactionSet then requires approval by User B. When User B approves the TransactionSet, then the LastApprovingUser becomes User B. And so on . . .

        Note: This method should only be called from Approval and Transaction Approval Rules. If this method is called from any other rule, then returns null.

      • getLimitRemaining

        public java.math.BigDecimal getLimitRemaining(AggregateLimit limit)
        Returns the remaining unused amount of a given aggregate limit. Specifically, this amount is equal to the limit amount minus the amount used. If the difference is negative, then zero is returned.
        Parameters:
        limit - An aggregate limit

      • getLimitRemainingIgnoringStatus

        public java.math.BigDecimal getLimitRemainingIgnoringStatus(AggregateLimit limit)
        Returns the remaining unused amount of a given aggregate limit. The amount includes all transactions in this TransactionSet based on their current status. Specifically, this amount is equal to the limit amount minus the amount used. If the difference is negative, then zero is returned.
        Parameters:
        limit - An aggregate limit

      • getLimitUsed

        public CurrencyAmount getLimitUsed(AggregateLimit limit)
        Returns the amount used of a given aggregate limit.
        Parameters:
        limit - An aggregate limit

      • getLimitUsedIgnoringStatus

        public CurrencyAmount getLimitUsedIgnoringStatus(AggregateLimit limit)
        Returns the amount used of a given aggregate limit. The amount includes all transactions in this TransactionSet regardless of their status.
        Parameters:
        limit - An aggregate limit

      • hasInvalidAggregateLimit

        public boolean hasInvalidAggregateLimit()
        For all aggregate limits that the transactions on this TransactionSet contribute to, returns true if any limit's Invalid flag is true. An Invalid limit means that the amount returned by aggregateLimit.LimitUsed is suspect. An aggregate limit may become invalid in two ways: 1) A staging table load brings in new transactions that might fall under an existing or newly-loaded aggregate limit. When this happens the aggregate limits on the corresponding policy period are marked as invalid. 2) An administrator's request to rebuild all the limit used values, which runs in the background, has not proceeded all the way through the database yet. If the aggregate limit is still invalid it means that the limit used value cannot be trusted to be accurate yet. In this case no guarantee is made that a transaction would either exceed or not exceed an aggregate limit. A batch job called AggLimitCalc can rebuild either all or just the invalid aggregate limits, depending on the parameter used when the job is run.
        Returns:
        If this transaction set is on a claim in a policy period in which at least one aggregate limit is invalid then this method returns true. Otherwise it returns false. Also returns false if the policy's policy periods have no aggregate limits.

      • hasLinkedDocument

        public boolean hasLinkedDocument(Document document)
        Return true if the given document is linked to this transaction set.

      • isApproved

        public boolean isApproved()
        Returns true if the TransactionSet is approved, i.e., its approval status is ApprovalStatus.TC_APPROVED.

      • isEditable

        public boolean isEditable()
        Returns true if the TransactionSet is editable, i.e., it is unapproval or rejected.

      • isExceedsApplicableLimit

        For all aggregate limits that the transactions on this TransactionSet contribute to, returns true if any limit's used amount is greater than its corresponding limit amount.

        Returns false if the policy's policy period has no aggregate limits.

      • isExceedsLimit

        public boolean isExceedsLimit()
        Returns true if this TransactionSet, when combined with all other TransactionSets for all aggregate limits that apply to the Policy of this TransactionSet's claim, returns true if any limit used is greater than its corresponding limit amount.

        Defaults to Limit.

        Returns false if the policy's policy period has no aggregate limits.

      • isRetired

        public java.lang.Boolean isRetired()
        Specified by:
        isRetired in interface Retireable
        Returns:
        True if the object has been retired from active use, false if the object is active. Retireable objects are never deleted from a database table, instead they are retired by setting the retired column to the same value as the ID of the object.

      • isWithinApplicableLimit

        public boolean isWithinApplicableLimit(java.math.BigDecimal amount)
        For all aggregate limits that the transactions on this TransactionSet contribute to, returns true if any limit's used amount is within a given amount of their corresponding limit amounts.

        For example, if the limit amount is $100 and the given amount is $20, then this method returns

        • false if the amount used is less than $80
        • true if the amount used is greater than or equal to $80 and less than or equal to $100
        • false if the amount used is greater than $100

        Returns false if the policy's policy period has no aggregate limits.

        Parameters:
        amount - The amount that is subtract from the limit amounts of all applicable aggregate limits. If amount is null, then amount is set to zero.

      • isWithinApplicableLimit

        public boolean isWithinApplicableLimit(java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                                       AggregateType valueType)

        • true if the amount used is greater than or equal to $80 and less than or equal to $100

        Returns false if the policy's policy period has no aggregate limits.

        Parameters:
        amount - The amount that is subtract from the limit amounts of all applicable aggregate limits. If amount is null, then amount is set to zero.
        valueType - AggregateType (Limit or Deductible)

      • rebuildAggregateLimits

        public int rebuildAggregateLimits()
        Rebuilds the LimitUsed for all aggregate limits on the PolicyPeriod for this transactionSet's claim. This method can be called from a Rule to ensure that the LimitUsed values are all up to date. At the end of this method, the aggregate limits associated with the policy period will be marked as valid. This could be a potentially time-consuming operation if the associated policy period has many claims with many transactions per claim on them.
        Returns:
        the number of aggregate limits rebuilt

      • refresh

        public KeyableBean refresh()
        Refreshes this bean with the latest database version.

        This method does nothing if the bean is edited or inserted in its current bundle. If the bean no longer exists in the database, then null is returned. If the bean has been evicted from its bundle, then null is returned. Otherwise, this bean is returned, with its contents updated.

        Specified by:
        refresh in interface Editable
        Specified by:
        refresh in interface KeyableBean
        Specified by:
        refresh in interface Retireable
        Specified by:
        refresh in interface Versionable

      • reject

        public void reject(ValidationLevel errorLevel,
                   java.lang.String strErrorReason,
                   ValidationLevel warningLevel,
                   java.lang.String strWarningReason)
        Rejects the root bean w/ a global message

        Note the reason why the bean failed validation shouldn't refer to a particular field in the entity. To do that, use the rejectField() method.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Specified by:
        reject in interface Validatable
        Parameters:
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.

      • rejectField

        public void rejectField(java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath,
                        ValidationLevel errorLevel,
                        java.lang.String strErrorReason,
                        ValidationLevel warningLevel,
                        java.lang.String strWarningReason)
        Rejects a particular field or field path on the root bean.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Specified by:
        rejectField in interface Validatable
        Parameters:
        strRelativeFieldPath - The relative path from the root bean to the field that failed validation.
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.

      • rejectSubFieldWithFlowStep

        public void rejectSubFieldWithFlowStep(KeyableBean relatedBean,
                                       java.lang.String strRelativeFieldPath,
                                       ValidationLevel errorLevel,
                                       java.lang.String strErrorReason,
                                       ValidationLevel warningLevel,
                                       java.lang.String strWarningReason,
                                       java.lang.String flowStepId)
        Reject a particular field of field path on a bean related to the root bean, e.g. an array element of the bean such as an Exposure of a Claim.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Note that this is the fullest version of "reject"; all the others are overloaded for easier use.

        Specified by:
        rejectSubFieldWithFlowStep in interface Validatable
        Parameters:
        relatedBean - Bean related to the root bean
        strRelativeFieldPath - The relative path from the root bean to the field that failed validation.
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.
        flowStepId - The process FlowStep that this error applies to, if any

      • rejectWithFlowStep

        public void rejectWithFlowStep(ValidationLevel errorLevel,
                               java.lang.String strErrorReason,
                               ValidationLevel warningLevel,
                               java.lang.String strWarningReason,
                               java.lang.String flowStepId)
        Rejects the root bean w/ a global message

        Note the reason why the bean failed validation shouldn't refer to a particular field in the entity. To do that, use the rejectField() method.

        Note you can indicate failure as both an error and a warning simultaneously. However, if the failure is both an error and a warning, the failure should have different error and warning levels.

        Specified by:
        rejectWithFlowStep in interface Validatable
        Parameters:
        errorLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation error.
        strErrorReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the error.
        warningLevel - The corresponding level effected by the validation warning.
        strWarningReason - The message that should be displayed to the user, to indicate the reason for the warning.
        flowStepId - The process FlowStep that this error applies to, if any

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Marks this bean for remove. A bean marked for remove will be deleted or retired when the transaction is committed. Once a bean is marked for remove, it cannot be switched to update, edit, or read.

        WARNING: This method is designed for simple custom entities which are normally not associated with other entities. Undesirable results may occur when used on out-of-box entities.

        Specified by:
        remove in interface Editable
        Specified by:
        remove in interface KeyableBean
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Retireable
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Versionable

      • removeFromActivities

        public void removeFromActivities(Activity element)
        Removes the given element from the Activities array. This is achieved by marking the element for removal.

      • removeFromActivities

        @Deprecated
public void removeFromActivities(Key elementID)
        Deprecated. Please use the version that takes an entity instead.
        Removes the given element from the Activities array. This is achieved by marking the element for removal.

      • requireApproval

        public boolean requireApproval(java.lang.String reason)
        Forces this TransactionSet to require approval.

        Note: This method should only be called from a rule in the Transaction Approval ruleset. Note: This method can only be called from rules.

        Parameters:
        reason - the reasons that approval is required

                                Group group)

        Parameters:
        user - A user
        group - A group
        Returns:
        false if the user or group is null or retired; true otherwise.

        Specified by:
        setRequestingUser in interface Approvable

      • testAuthorityLimits

        public ApprovalResult testAuthorityLimits()
        Tests whether the user's authority limits force approval to be required for this TransactionSet. During initial approval, RequestingUser may be null, in which case it checks the AuthorityLimits of the current user. Note: After approving an approval activity, Approval Rules are run again. At that time, RequestingUser is still the previous RequestingUser, not the last approving user. In most cases you'll want to have a line like "TransactionSet.RequestingUser = TransactionSet.LastApprovingUser" in your rule before calling this method.
        Returns:
        ApprovalResult indicating whether approval is needed and if so, the reasons why

      • touch

        public void touch()
        Set's the version of the bean to the next value (i.e. the bean version original value+1) Multiple calls to this method on the same bean will result in the same value being used for the version (i.e. it is idempotent). Calling this method will force the bean to be written to the database and participate fully in the commit cycle e.g. pre-update rules will be run, etc.
        Specified by:
        touch in interface Editable
        Specified by:
        touch in interface Retireable
        Specified by:
        touch in interface Versionable

      • validate

        public ValidationResult validate()
        Executes new transaction validation rules on the supplied TransactionSet, and returns a validation object containing any errors (if validation was successful, an empty validation object is returned).
        Returns:
        a ValidationResult containing 0 or more errors
